item.description: 2.1 Dagger Scene Is this a dagger which I see before me, The handle toward my hand? Come, let me clutch thee.
Act 3 Summary Created: 2022-05-11 05:54 The climax of the entire play, Act 3 is arguably the most important act in Romeo and Juliet.
Act 4 Summary Created: 2022-05-11 10:26 Juliet takes the vial and “dies.” That’s the most important part of it. Shakespeare really stretched this out into a whole act.

Act 5 Summary Created: 2022-05-22 15:59 [[Act 5 Scene 1|Scene 1]]: Romeo buys poison [[Romeo]] finds out that [[Juliet]] is dead from [[Balthasar]] Romeo buys poison from a poor apothecary and decides to use kill himself with it in front of Juliet’s grave [[Act 5 Scene 2|Scene 2]]: Letter never got sent to Romeo [[Friar Lawrence]] finds out that his message to Romeo never got sent He plans to quickly go to the tomb and wait for Romeo [[Act 5 Scene 3|Scene 3]]: The death of Romeo and Juliet end the fued between the two familes [[Paris]] scatters flowers over Juliet’s tomb Romeo enters the graveyard and Paris hides Romeo opens Juliet’s tomb Paris catches him in the act Romeo and Paris fight, and Romeo kills Paris Paris’s page runs away to call the officials Romeo drinks the poison and dies Friar Lawrence comes, but Juliet tells him to go away Juliet promtly kills herself with Romeo’s knife just as the guards come Everyone comes, including [[Lord Capulet]],[[ Lady Capulet]], [[Lord Montague]], and the [[Prince]].
Inaccuracies in Taylor Swift’s “Love Story” Created: 2022-05-27 09:35 Apparently, Taylor Swift got some details mixed up and put some inaccurate content in her song, Love Story.
Juliet’s fate Created: 2022-05-20 06:19 Was this Juliet’s only future, or did Juliet make her own? (Make a mind map of this by Command + M)
Romeo’s monologue in Act 3 Scene 3 Created: 2022-05-26 16:45 This is a modern translation of the [[Act 3 Scene 3#^8043d3|monologue]] (3.
